metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1235 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The oarsh script in OAR before 2.5.7 allows remote authenticated users of a cluster to obtain sensitive information and possibly gain privileges via vectors related to OpenSSH options. It was discovered that OAR incorrectly handled OpenSSH options. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information or gain privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboar-perl - 2.5.7-1
oar-common - 2.5.7-1
oar-node - 2.5.7-1
oar-restful-api - 2.5.7-1
oar-server - 2.5.7-1
oar-server-mysql - 2.5.7-1
oar-server-pgsql - 2.5.7-1
oar-user - 2.5.7-1
oar-user-mysql - 2.5.7-1
oar-user-pgsql - 2.5.7-1
oar-web-status - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oar package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
